reviewText:
As soon as I loaded this game up, I knew exactly what I was in for. Developed by Reiza Studios, the same folks behind the excellent Game Stock Car 2013 (Extreme now) and Formula Truck 2013 series of games, this is pretty much the same thing, but on the Brazilian stock car circuit. While not familiar with the Brazilian circuit myself, I thoroughly enjoy the aforementioned games, and anyone else that is familiar with those will feel right at home as well. This is mainly the reason that I am able to write this review with such little play time on this at the moment!

So on to the gameplay! Once you're behind the wheel of either of three different car manufacturers (for now anyway), you'll see the familiar gMotor 2 engine used with these games, from the HUD to the ever-so-lovely shift/rpm gauge. Of course, these can be turned off (thankfully), which gives you a more realistic sim experience, if that is your cup of tea. And yes, you can change the view from the default cockpit! This is found in the Options > Display menu. There are a multitude of other settings that can be changed as well, from the number of cars seen on-screen at once to graphical settings. Most gamers with mid to high range machines can naturally max out these settings, as the graphics are not quite up to the same standards as Asetto Corsa and the likes. But, to me anyway, they look pretty good right out of the box, so to speak. This can also be said for the car handling physics, which are the same as other entries from Reiza Studios. And that is to say that they are some of the best that I have experienced in any racing game to date. Again, those that have played the games I mentioned know what I am referring to.

In summary, if you've played the other games Reiza has offered, you know what you're in for, and will feel right at home once you're in the game. If you're even remotely interested in racing games that are more of a simulation, then you should definitely give this a try. And heck, even if you don't like racing games, give it a try anyway. After all, how can you go wrong with a free game, especially one of this magnitude. What are you waiting for, add it to your Steam library right now!!!

reviewText:
Copa Petrobras de Marcas is a game based on the well-known rFactor engine by ISI, and that is a big thing in this game: this engine is known for its lifelike physics simulation, tons of customisation options and modding features. The result is that the game offers a solid, reliable driving experience similar to games such as GTR and F1 Challenge 99-02, though in a different scenario: Brazilian racecars and circuits, recreated with great attention to detail - thanks Reiza Studios!

It is important to notice that, as a serious race simulation, the game requires a steering wheel if you want to enjoy what it has to offer. Graphics are a bit outdated, but the overall driving experience, the sound and the detailed models make up for it. On the other hand, the game doesn't require a Master Race desktop setup.

If you're Brazilian, you know what to expect. If you're not, it's chance to know some tracks popular in Ayrton Senna's country, and take some popular vehicles such as the Focus, the Lancer and the Corolla for a drive. In the real competition, these cars are equipped with a similar engine and a fixed ratio gearbox (this aspect was thoroughly recreated in the game).

Most importantly, Copa Petrobras de Marcas is free to play. Not the microtransaction type, it is actually free! Great driving model, accurate vehicles and tracks, realistic sound and a highly competitive AI for free - quite a deal, aye?

PEOPLE GIVING MARCAS A NEGATIVE RATING MUST BE COMPLETELY BONKERS OR COMPLETELY SIMPLE...JUST DISGUSTING TO SEE THIS FINE FREE SIM RACER GET A MIXED REVIEW!

If you are on a tight budget - there is simply no better sim racer you can find with such a complete single player championship experience, only raceroom experience comes close.

There is absolutely no reason for people who are into racing not to like what Copa Petrobras de Marcas has to offer FOR FREE. The only reason this game is free is because Brazil's largest oil company Petrobras is paying the bill. Marcas is a promotional game built on a quality sim engine, by people who know how to make this engine shine better than the original programmers.

You get a FULL TC championship, with the same great handling that comes with Reizas Game Stock Car series.

If you have a FFB steering wheel you are in for a treat, as Reiza's Stock Car series has been universally recognized as having one of the best driving models in the business. The graphics are crisp and functional, without unnessessary eye candy (check SweetFX*), so the game can be played on most mid range machines at the highest graphical settings.

I was actually happy that the Marcas content was recently added to the Stock Car Extreme game, as it is one one my favorite Reiza classes to drive - being front wheel driven they require a different style. FWD is another detail some negative reviews seem to miss when they discuss handling.

As for the comment on driving views - there are many camera views (!), in and outside the car.

Before posting negative reviews, take a little time to check the set up possibilities, controls etc, and you'll find that almost anything can be set up. Same for FFB, it can be tweaked to near perfection. At best any negatives given on these issues show a lack of looking for the proper settings - read stupidity of the reviewer.

Most of the negative comments seem to come from people who are expecting an arcade racer, with basic one size fits all ez mode, game pad support, game pad friendly handling and eye candy" visuals.

Unfortunately by doing so they completely miss the point - as non target audience of this game - and trash the game accordingly.

Pearls before swine I'm tempted to say.....

reviewText:
Briefly.

CONS

1) defualt assist settings mean the car drives itself effectively. Just remember when to lift at the end of the straights.

2) change the assists and the car still tries to steer itself a little in the corners. Set the FFB to above zero and you can feel it. at +50% (yes it is possible to have -50%) you end up fighting the wheel to strighten up to the line out of the corners.

3) if you don't like the bumper view the camera options are horrible

4) I tired interlagos for 20 minutes. At the end of the pit straight the braking markers on the right side are missing and with the camera view it is impossible to judge the braking distance. I did 10 laps and went off every time.

5) Although it has many defualt wheel configs they all need to be customised and it's not immediately obvious how you do it.

Pros

1) race 07/rfacetor engine.

2) defualt setup for the evo (only car i tried) is good. very grippy and stable.

3) free

Conclusion

If you are new to racing games. This is one to try. It will help teach you the racing lines and how a car should feel before you dive into something like LFS/ Race 07/Asstto Corsa. If you have any experience, it's best to avoid unless you want an easy game to play while drinking and driving but the Need For Speed games exist for that purpose.

reviewText:
I tend to review games in different sections people tend to look for:
Graphics: 68/100. The Cars them selves look very nice. The surroundings are not particularly great, however you shouldnt notice it if you are looking where you are going! ;)
User Interface (UI): 46/100. It doesnt look the prettiest. Simple design however it feels like it's the wrong colours that just make it look... not right?
Artificial Intelligence (AI): 96/100. The AI feels perfect. They notice that your there (unlike other tittles recently). They know if you are faster then them then they would move over to let you through. But dont think it's that easy ;) If a bot wants to challenge they will. You can get some really good battles.
Frames Per Second (FPS): 85/100. I didn't have many FPS drops when playing it that were particularly noticeable. I wasnt sure how many frames I do drop because I had to use the Keyboard to drive, due to the game not noticing my wheel.
Sounds: 87/100. The car sounds are good. The music is meh, but you can turn tht off in the menu. The game notices what type of terrain you driving over, for example when going over rumble strips, you for sure know you are.
Content: Currently at 68/100. There are only the one class of car currently in the game. There are about 6 different race tracks. About 4 different types of car. Single race, Test day and Championship. I am not sure if they are planning to add more content in the furture?
Controls: 72/100. The game does have a few wheels that it knows, such as G25 or the G27 and some Thrustmaster ones like the TM 500. You can use a Xbox gamepad and your keyboard. (If you do use your Keyboard make sure to check the keybinding's)
Overall rating = 73/100
Overall great for a Free to Play! If you like racing games then I would suggest this to you. Only a small download nothing big. Good base to the game if they want to make more content. Few problems with the UI looking weird, all in all, worth the download.
